{"step_by_step_thinking": "The experience of pediatric housestaff can influence the tests ordered for infants in the neonatal intensive care unit. More experienced staff may have a better understanding of which tests are necessary and when they should be ordered. They may also be more confident in their clinical judgement and therefore order fewer unnecessary tests. On the other hand, less experienced staff may order more tests as they may be less confident in their clinical judgement and want to rule out as many potential issues as possible.", "answer_choice": "A"}
